text: A signature dish from Morelos, especially famous in Cuernavaca’s surroundings. Thinly sliced and salted beef, often served with cream, cheese, avocado, and handmade tortillas. It’s a staple of local gastronomy.

A traditional Mexican delight prepared with fresh squash blossoms, folded into corn tortillas with cheese and cooked on a comal. Popular in Cuernavaca’s markets, these quesadillas highlight the region’s use of fresh, seasonal ingredients.

Colorful and creative artisanal ice creams from nearby Tepoztlán, loved in Cuernavaca. Known for unique flavors like rose petal, mezcal, and tropical fruits, they reflect the area’s playful and refreshing culinary side.
